lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Duke is a simple task management application that allows users to keep track
* of tasks, including to-dos, deadlines, and events.
* Duke uses a command-based approach, where users enter text commands to
* perform various operations on the task list.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
* This method initializes the user interface, loads tasks from storage,
* and enters a loop to process user commands.
* The main method that starts the Duke application.
* @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* The `ByeCommand` class represents a command to exit the Duke application.
public String execute(TaskList items, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
* The `Command` class represents a command that can be executed by the Duke application.
* A flag indicating whether executing this command should cause the application to exit.
* Executes the command, performing the associated action on the task list, UI, and storage.
* @param items   The task list to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage component for reading/writing data.
* @throws DukeException If an error occurs while executing the command.
public abstract String execute(TaskList items, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* Checks if executing this command should cause the application to exit.
* @return `true` if the application should exit after executing this command, `false` otherwise.
* The `DeadlineCommand` class represents a command to add a deadline task to the task list.
* Constructs a new `DeadlineCommand` with the specified name and deadline.
* @param name The name of the deadline task.
* @param by   The deadline date and time.
public String execute(TaskList items, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
* The `DeleteCommand` class represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a new `DeleteCommand` with the specified task number to be deleted.
* @param deleteNumber The task number to be deleted.
public String execute(TaskList items, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

* @param name The name of the event task.
* @param from The start date and time of the event.
* @param to   The end date and time of the event.
public EventCommand(String name, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {

* The `ListCommand` class represents a command to list the tasks in the task list.

* @param markIndex The index of the task to be marked as done.
public String execute(TaskList items, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

* @param name The name of the to-do task.
public String execute(TaskList items, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
* The `UnmarkCommand` class represents a command to unmark a task as not done in the task list.
* Constructs a new `UnmarkCommand` with the specified task index to be unmarked as not done.
* @param unmarkIndex The index of the task to be unmarked as not done.
public String execute(TaskList items, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
